value.name: After George Floyd, other families demand justice after police killings
value.description: In the year since George Floyd was murdered, police officers have killed hundreds of Americans. The families of the deceased said they want justice.

value.name: Tragedy of 195 black people killed by police in US since George Floyd's murder
value.description: In 2020 1,127 people were killed by police in the US, with black victims accounting for 27 per cent despite making up just 13 per cent of the population

value.name: Editorial: A year after George Floyd's death, Texas Legislature has failed to make promised reforms
value.description: George Floyd, who was raised in Houston, was murdered on that day in May by the former officer, Derek Chauvin. The fact that Chauvin was convicted of murder and awaits sentencing is a mark of progress.

value.name: I. Pedagogy Toward Refusal
value.description: The threats against Black life can operate so profoundly within the university that refusal may be the only option. Second, there is a positive and creative dynamic in refusal. It is an act that is generative of a new way of being.

value.name: COLUMN: A year after George Floyd's death, police brutality remains prevalent

value.name: Texas police officer arrested in weekend shooting that killed 31-year-old Black man
value.description: The family of Jonathan Price says the 31-year-old former college football player was unarmed and intervening in a domestic disturbance when he was shot by a police officer Saturday night.
